intro: Anemonastrum rupestre, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a low-growing perennial that thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often found in desert environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, adding a subtle splash of color to its harsh habitat. Its leaves are typically small, hairy, and adapted to reduce water loss, reflecting its drought-resistant nature. Anemonastrum rupestre plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and supporting local wildlife.
